[Program 4]
The Encoder class handles the main function and trivial operations (including 
calculating entropy), and the Huffman class handles the creation of the Huffman 
tree, and the encoding and decoding of files.
I was not sure what exactly was supposed to be written into testText.enc1
and testText.dec1, so I implemented it to where the encoded version of testText 
is written to testText.enc1, and the decoded version of testText.enc1 is written 
to testText.dec1.

[Finish]
My program currently parses the list of frequencies, creates a Huffman 
encoding, calculates the entropy given these frequencies, generates the 
testText file with k random characters in the alphabet, encodes testTxt 
and saves it in testText.enc1, calculates the entropy of testText encoding, 
compares the two entropies, and decodes testText.enc1 and saves it in 
testText.dec1. My program does not consider the 2 symbol derived alphabet
at all, so steps 5, 6, and 7 on the assignment page are not implemented.
